title: Naked Single
short: A cell where only one digit can fit given row, column, and box constraints.
how_to_detect: Compute candidates. If a cell has exactly one candidate, place it.

title: Hidden Single
short: A digit that appears as a candidate in only one cell within a unit (row/column/box).
how_to_detect: For each unit and digit 1–9, if the digit is a candidate in exactly one cell, place it.

title: Locked Candidates (Pointing)
short: If all candidates for a digit in a 3×3 box lie in one row/column, eliminate that digit from the rest of that row/column outside the box.
how_to_detect: Scan each box for a digit whose candidates fall in a single row/column; eliminate elsewhere in that line.

title: Locked Candidates (Claiming)
short: If all candidates for a digit in a row/column lie within one box, eliminate that digit from other cells in that box.
how_to_detect: Scan each row/column for a digit whose candidates lie in a single box; eliminate in that box.

title: X-Wing
short: A pattern where a digit occupies two cells in two rows (or columns) aligned as a rectangle, allowing eliminations.
how_to_detect: Look for two rows where a digit appears in exactly two columns, same columns in both rows; eliminate digit from other cells in those columns.

title: A Short History of Sudoku
short: Sudoku evolved from Latin squares (Euler) to modern number puzzles popularized in Japan, then worldwide in the 2000s.
how_to_use: Provide on-demand as a fun aside; keep it brief and optional.
